textList.name: ORCHID_FREE_ITEMS
textList.text: A friendly Gathering station at the beacon is offering scrap metal for free. Using sign language, they message you. "Military vessel? You can have our excess scrap. We're in the transition to using titanwood instead."
The beacon is empty, with no ships or stars around. A single container, resembling a giant seed, is drifting through space. There are some useful scrap and resources within.
The beacon is located far away from systems populated by Florals. Some remains of destroyed ships are floating around; aftermath of a battle long ago. You harvest what you can.
A Gathering terraforming station hails you. "We recently removed some old mining equipment from this planet and have no use for the excess scrap. You can have it."

event.name: ORCHID_UNARMED
event.text: A tiny Orchid civilian vessel awaits you at the beacon. They sign to you, "A Renegade? I never thought I'd really be face to face with one of you! Oh oh, wait! Here, have this as a gift! Thank you for your service to the Federation, captain!"

choice.text: Extort additional resources: they surely have more.

event.text: "What are you doing? No no no, please! Don't hurt us! I'll give you everything I can, just please let me go! I have a family! My children haven't even outgrown their planter yet!"

As soon as they've finished transferring the supplies, the Orchids jump away. Your pockets are a lot heavier now, but it's not often you meet someone with a high respect for Renegades, and now you've tarnished it forever.

choice.text: Kill the Orchid and take everything he has.

event.text: You send your crew over aboard to the ship and slaughter the Orchid and his few crew members. In his final moments, the captain manages only to whisper his first spoken word since you met him - a simple "Why?" Disappointingly, you don't find too much more than what he had already offered.

event.name: ORCHID_BOTANICAL_GALLERY
event.text: A giant Orchid station is located at the beacon. It's marked as an "Augmented Botanical Gallery" on your star map.
The atmosphere of tranquillity with a small touch of curiosity fills the main hall. There are all kinds of strange exhibits in the gallery. You wonder which to visit.

choice.text: Pay an entry fee to visit "May's Burst".

event.text: The exhibit contains a giant sphere, protected from all sides with reinforced metal coating. Giant trees are growing inside. You are a bit disappointed.

Suddenly, a series of explosions rocks the entire station wing. The trees are bursting, releasing giant kernels out. The protective sphere can barely stop the kernels from destroying the station. The service Orchids offer a weapon created for firing kernels for free.

choice.text: Pay an entry fee to visit "Ham Pie".

event.text: The exhibit contains a field of... grass. It looks like usual Earth grass with plain flowers but has a strangely familiar leaf pattern. Was it really worth it?

After a few minutes on the meadow you feel your worries go away, a desire to laugh, and an irresistible urge to hug a Mantis nearby. After a while, you and the Mantis who turned out to be another visitor become best friends and they agree to join your crew.

choice.text: Pay an entry fee to visit "Quick Sap".

event.text: This exhibit is a giant machine which is made entirely from plant matter. The contraption tap lean white-barked trees of sap and moves the sap into the processing part which outputs a liquid advertised as high quality FTL fuel.
Since you have already paid for entry, the Orchids are offering some of the experimental fuel for free.

choice.text: Leave the gallery without visiting anything.

event.text: You have no interest in the station.

event.name: ORCHID_SEEDS
event.text: A large seed-like pod drifts by, made partly of organic matter and clearly of Gathering design. Typically, these pods contain various valuables, resources, or humanitarian supplies. This one however seems different, althought you're not quite sure why.

choice.text: Take the risk and open it.
(Floral Crew) Have your Orchid inform you about the pod's purpose.

event.text: Your Orchid explains that this is a seedling pod, made from the strongest of titanwood. They can contain numerous different things, from Orchid crew to Kernel weapons!

choice.text: If we can't predict what's inside, we shouldn't open it.

event.text: Though you now know the pod's purpose, that doesn't eliminate any risk of opening it.

choice.text: Ignore the pod, it could be dangerous.

event.text: You let the bizarre pod drift on through space.

Disappointingly, you find nothing inside the pod besides a few missiles. Looks like this was a weapon cache, although for whom you can't be sure because it's been almost entirely emptied. Satisfied that at least it wasn't boobytrapped, you cut your losses and leave.

You crack open the pod only to find a starving crew of pirates inside! This appears to once have been a pirate weapon cache, but after getting sealed inside, the betrayed crew has turned to ferocious cannibalistic rage and attacks you!

You crack open the pod and find a scattered array of weapons and other haphazard equipment. Seems this pod was repurposed by pirates as a weapon cache. It's fortunately unguarded, so you decide to take whatever you can carry.

event.name: ORCHID_TERRAFORMERS
event.text: A Gathering scout hails you, asking for the "prudent services of a well-equipped vessel". They explain that the nearby planet which they've been tasked to investigate is a candidate for a terraforming operation. However, they've since heard rumors of a potential Coalition spy operation hosted on the surface, and command didn't properly outfit them to handle such matters. They request that you investigate for them, and permit you to keep anything valuable you find.
You don't have the time, or maybe the courage, to go poking around for potential Coalition bases.
While exploring the planet you find the remains of a crashed Coalition ship, but there seems to be no survivors. You report the news back to the Orchids and they thank you for your assistance.

While exploring the planet, you come across a crashed Coalition ship! The last surviving crew member flashes several SOS signals, trying to get your attention. They claim to have been harmlessly passing through the sector when they were shot down by Gathering security and left for dead on this barren planet. They're desperate for rescue - so desperate that they're even willing to work for you.

choice.text: Accept them on board and sneak past the Florals.

event.text: Lying won't do you any good here once they find the ship, so the only option once you've recruited the Coalition member is to fly away and hope the Orchids aren't too bothered.

choice.text: Report their location to the Florals.

event.text: You ignore the SOS message and return to the scout, reporting the news. "Ah, I guess that's better than a whole operation. I'll call for backup and have law enforcement pick them up soon. They'll determine if that 'harmlessly passing through' story is true and decide what to do from there. Thank you for the help."

Sure enough, it seems a Coalition base of operations has been covertly set-up on the other side of the planet. As soon as you enter scanning range, they deploy an armed craft to dispose of you before you can reveal their location!
Scans of the planet reveal no signs of the Coalition, save for a single crashed ship with no apparent survivors. You report the news back to the Orchids and they thank you for your assistance.

While scanning the planet, you discover a crashed Coalition ship! The last surviving crew member flashes several SOS signals, trying to get your attention. They claim to have been harmlessly passing through the sector when they were shot down by Gathering security and left for dead on this barren planet. They're desperate for rescue - so desperate that they're even willing to work for you.

choice.text: Accept them on board and sneak past the Florals.

choice.text: Report their location to the Florals.

event.text: You ignore the SOS message and return to the scout, reporting the news. "Ah, I guess that's better than a whole operation. I'll call for backup and have law enforcement pick them up soon. They'll determine if that 'harmlessly passing through' story is true and decide what to do from there. Thank you for the help."

Your scans reveal the location of a Coalition base, just as the Florals predicted. The base has only one active fighter vessel, but you doubt you'd be able to take the whole base down on your own without some serious firepower.
You might not be able to take out the base, but you can at least assist in reducing their firepower. You lock onto the Coalition vessel and jump into action!

choice.text: Set an explosive device to cripple the base. [-15}]

event.text: The heavy payload you set creates a gigantic explosion, destroying the whole left wing of the base! The ship guarding it is also heavily damaged, and the Coalition staff are forced to evacuate. You report back to the Orchids, who call in immediate backup to arrest the spies. You're rewarded tremendously for your assistance.

choice.text: Report the base back to the Orchids.

event.text: The Florals are thankful for your assistance, although highly alarmed at the presence of the base. "It's the Weedlings, trying to join the Coalition! It's given them justification to start spying on us to try and win those swampland bastards over! Hopefully once we report this to command, they'll file a request for Federation support."

event.name: ORCHID_TERRAFORMER_COALITION_WIN
event.text: The Florals are thankful for your assistance, although highly alarmed at the presence of the base. "It's the Weedlings, trying to join the Coalition! It's given them justification to start spying on us to try and win those swampland bastards over! Hopefully once we report this to command, they'll file a request for Federation support."

event.name: ORCHID_PETITION
event.text: A Gathering vessel nearby hails you. "Captain, are you of high standing with the Federation? If so, we could use your influence! The Gathering's insistence on maintaining our economic system in such fashions has proved disastrous for our economy! The Confederates are outcompeting us ten-fold! Would you sign this petition, so that we may one day soon begin heavier industrialization ourselves?"

Mayeb points sternly at the Orchid. "Pardon me, but wouldn't your organization happen to be funded by the Flowering Infrastructure of the Gathering?"
The Orchid lowers his paper and he starts to squint. "Oh no."
"Yes, of course I know who you are. Your organizations are always trying to pitch a fit about 'oh, the economy, the poor economy' - You're just looking out for yourselves! Not that I particularly care about money, but for the average civilian, true economic enrichment requires that we keep them and their environment in safety."
"I don't have to listen to this!" The Orchid's ship starts to arm itself - it looks like she's provoked them.
You scribble your name on the paper, pledging your support to the industrialization of the Gardenworlds. "Thank you so kindly captain! Some day the Gathering will thank you for this!"

choice.text: Sign the petition and offer a charitable donation.

event.text: You scribble your name on the paper and also have your crew pass over some extra scrap from the cargo bay.
"Oh, wow! May Cyrtal'y Mncolo provide you its greatest bounties! I did not know foreigners could be so generous... Some day the Gathering will thank you for this!"
The Florals nod. "I am dissapointed, but I can respect your decision. Safe travels."

You point your finger at the plants and laugh at their silly attempts to improve the economy. The Floral captain growls, and their vines perk up in anger. "You could simply have said no! There was no necessity in mocking us for wishing better for our own people!"

event.name: ORCHID_KERNEL_FOREST
event.text: This planet boasts a stunning array of alien flora. It's quite the spectacle.
You find a lone Orchid wandering about the forest, a single watering can in hand. He waves to you as you land nearby and exit your ship. "Welcome to my gardens. I hope you enjoy!"
"Yes, that is correct. I am the Caretaker of this planet. This is one of the planets on which we grow the plant components of our Kernel weapons. Would you care to purchase one?"

choice.text: (Floral Crew) Ask the Caretaker to join you.

event.text: "Oh... I don't know if I could... this is a very important job... though I don't get out much... I'm sure the gardens will be fine until I return."

choice.text: Attempt to steal one of the weapons.

event.text: You arm your weapons, hoping it won't take much to convince the Orchid to hand over a weapon. Instead, an Orchid ship comes flying from nowhere and attacks! You're chased out of the garden by the ship, but they won't let you go without a fight.

choice.text: We aren't interested in buying anything.
Ok, time's up. Let's get moving.

event.text: You don't have time to gaze at all the plant life, you must hurry on with your mission.
"A good choice. May it serve you well in your travels!"
"A good choice. May it serve you well in your travels!"
