event.name: ORCHID_MEGATREE
event.text: In the distance lies a giant, well-developed Orchid city. You don't often see Orchid communities up close, and this one appears to be unique. A giant tree with a stadium around it has been built in the center of the city for all to see. It looks to be a tourist attraction of sorts.

You receive a popup on your screen asking for your native language. After configuring it from a very long list of dialects, a voice welcomes you to what is referred to as D'Wretq Aeth in Orchid dialect, though people in your language often call it 'The Mega Tree'.
The virtual tour guide offers to give you a full guide of the tree and the history of its origins, for a small fee.

The tour guide then launches into a long and incredibly boring tale of Orchid diplomatic missions with the Rockmen, some minor civil wars among two Orchid clans, the founding of the new Orchid government, an increase in intergalactic pesticide usage, and concerns over vegetarianism. One story does catch your attention however, a tale about a powerful Kernel weapon buried underneath the tree during a pirate raid.
You attempt to land near the base of the tree, but an Orchid guard stops you, furious that you dare try to harm the tree.

choice.text: (Floral Crew) Convince the Mega-Tree guards to let you have the weapon.
(Caretaker Crew) Convince the Mega-Tree guards to let you have the weapon.
(Praetor Crew) Convince the Mega-Tree guards to let you have the weapon.
(Mayeb) Convince the Mega-Tree guards to let you have the weapon.

event.text: Mayeb explains to the guards that with her years of gardening experience, retrieving the Kernel weapon without harming the tree should be easy with her supervision. After a brief discussion among themselves, they agree to this proposal. It doesn't take long to excavate it, and indeed the tree appears to be entirely unharmed at the end of it.

choice.text: (Ty E'Rel) Convince the Mega-Tree guards to let you have the weapon.

event.text: You leave Ty E'rel on the comms to organize an agreement with the guards regarding the buried weapon. The negotiating is almost astonishingly boring, with the names of numerous treaties and agreements you didn't even know existed flying around throughout. After a few dull minutes, your crew are cleared to retrieve the Kernel weapon.

choice.text: (Flares) Launch a flare to distract the guards and buy you time.

event.text: Baffled by the array of holographic discs, most of the tree's defense moves to investigate. Your crew slip past and quickly dig up the weapon and some spare ammunition then slip away without being noticed.

choice.text: We can't risk it. Just leave.

event.text: The voice doesn't speak to you again. After a while you get bored and leave.
Your mission is too important to be spending time at alien tourist locations.

event.name: ORCHID_MEGATREE_WIN
event.text: Civilians and tourists alike flee in terror as the guard plummets into the base of the tree, setting it ablaze. You hurry out of the ship and break a hole in the trunk, surprised to find it hollow. You hurry through the smoke and grab the Kernel weapon and head back to the ship.

event.name: ORCHID_MEGATREE_TALK_SUCCESS
event.text: Your Orchid manages to convince the guards of the utmost importance of your mission. They sanction you to send crew down to dig up the weapon, so long as you cause no damage to the tree.

event.name: ORCHID_MEGATREE_TALK_FAIL
event.text: The guards refuse to grant you access to the weapon.

choice.text: Ignore them and dig for it anyways.

event.text: You attempt to land near the base of the tree, but an Orchid guard stops you, furious that you dare try to harm the tree.

event.name: ORCHID_REFUGEES
event.text: As you approach the beacon, you notice a Syndicate vessel accosting what seems to be a Gathering immigration center! You catch a few scattered messages between the two parties. "Hand over the fugitive immediately and no one else has to get hurt! You think you can hide them forever? The Theocracy will just keep sending more and more troops until you're all dead! You fancy a Crusader bashing down your doors right now?"
You won't stand for such a blatant injustice when you can have your word in it. You align your crosshairs on mercenary scum once more.
There's not much reason for you to get involved in this, and it could be dangerous anyways.

event.name: ORCHID_REFUGEES_WIN
event.text: The station is in utter disarray, with prospectful immigrants and Gathering staff members alike huddled under makeshift shelter, and a scattering of disorganized security guards on the alert. You receive a hail not from the staff but rather from a lone Rockman. "Thank god you came! The Mercenaries jammed the comms and the staff couldn't send a distress signal to the Praetorian in time! My name's Korben, and I trust you're friendly faces. I was a Lost Sun once, but I wanted a new life away from the fighting. Bless Ariadne, she arranged everything personally to get me out of there! The Gathering seemed a better choice over the Union for a new life, but now it seems I'll never be free of these mercenaries!"

choice.text: Offer to take him with you.

event.text: "I'm not... too inclined to join back up with another military operation, but I suppose saving the Multiverse takes a bit of a higher precedent anyways, right? Maybe once this is over, the Theocracy will finally give up on me."

choice.text: (Ariadne) "Buckle up soldier, the Multiverse needs all the help it can get."

event.text: At the sight of the admiral, Korben breaks into a salute. "Admiral! Of course! I will do everything I can to assist. I can seek a new life after, but under the rule of the Rebellion, none of us will be safe!"
"Er... yes, of course. You've already helped more than enough. I'll talk to the staff, and make sure you're rewarded for this..."

event.name: ORCHID_ESCAPE
event.text: You encounter a giant Gathering transport ship with a military escort. You receive a hail from somewhere onboard. "Please help me. I've been wrongfully detained and broken free from my cell. They'll find me soon, if you rescue me I'll do whatever you want!"

The Floral captain is pleased with your effort to help them. "I knew the Federation had our back." He gestures towards the Orchid you just turned in. "We caught this one stealing government secrets. Some kind of capitalist spy from the Confederacy, I presume. He'll face just action in time, but for your loyalty it seems a reward is in order!"

choice.text: (Upg. Teleporter) Teleport the Orchid aboard unnoticed.

event.text: You lock onto the Orchid with your teleporter and beam him aboard. "Thank you, captain. I was so afraid... they think I'm a spy for the Confederacy! I'd have been executed if you hadn't helped me! The Praetorian has been cracking down, to the point anyone's a suspect unless they're a true greenblood! It's madness!"
You don't need any more crew, and this sounds shady regardless.

You sneak aboard the transport ship and escort the Orchid back to your ship. He thanks you generously, but doesn't seem to want to talk about why he was detained. Fortunately, no one spots the rescue and you leave without a hitch.

You sneak aboard the transport ship and escort the Orchid back to your ship. On the way however, you're spotted and the Orchids open fire! The Floral you're escorting is caught in the crossfire and your crew barely make it back alive in time to fight the now enraged escort!

You sneak aboard the transport ship and escort the Orchid back to your ship. On the way however, you're spotted and the Orchids open fire! Fortunately, all of your crew, including the Orchid you're escorting, make it back alive in time to fight the now enraged escort!

As you sneak aboard the ship to rescue the criminal, you notice it's not actually a Floral you're rescuing but rather a Vampweed! "Thank you, I was just a merchant passing through and they arrested me because of my red petals!" You nod and hurry back to the ship, but unfortunately you're caught by security and are going to have to fight your way out!

event.name: ORCHID_MERCENARY
event.text: An unarmed Floral Caretaker vessel is trying to flee from a Syndicate mercenary vessel that's chasing them. You have no idea what the reason would be, but should you do something to save them?

You fire a warning shot and the pirate ship changes direction to face you. "Ah shit, Renegade scum? Of course it'd be you who decides to interfere with Syndicate contracts! Fine, have it your way. We'll just kill you first!"

choice.text: Bribe the Syndicate into leaving them alone.

event.text: "Hmmm... that is a lot of scrap. And if we can get the bounty too, well that's even better!" The mercenary turns to the Orchids and warns them. "Now you better play nice and play dead! Otherwise, we'll be back here soon to finish the job!" Once the mercenaries jump away, the Floral thanks you and pleads for you in sign language to take them. "Please, ever since I got involved in that radical cell wanting to ditch communism, I've been followed everywhere by people wanting me dead! I can't go back to my old life, but maybe I can find a new one with you!"

choice.text: Decline and ask for alternative payment.

event.text: For as much as the Syndicate and Renegades don't get along, no reason to get involved in this business.

The Orchid vessel took significant damage prior to your fight, but the crew are still alive. With hasty sign language, the Orchids thank you for your help. "I made a terrible mistake, and joined a capitalist cell trying to convince the Gathering to pull back its communist policies. Now, I feel like I'm being followed everywhere I go! Please, take me with you. I can't stay here anymore!"

The vessel seems to have received heavy damage, and unfortunately their crew didn't survive the fight. Although you'll never know why the mercenaries were tracking them now, you suppose they won't be needing their scrap any longer.
Unfortunately, the Orchids seem to have jumped away during the fight. You're a bit disappointed and a little angry, but you can't exactly blame them for taking the opportunity.

event.name: ORCHID_SLAVES
event.text: A rogue ship awaits you at the beacon. "Laborers for cheap! Can be used as oxygen emitters, cannon fodder, gifts to tribal chiefs, firewood, or healthy food!" The pirate scratches his chin. "Not that I support cannibalism. I'm just saying, they're very versatile."

choice.text: Piracy is despicable. Attack the slavers!

event.text: You attack the slavers.

choice.text: (Caretaker Crew) Appeal to the pirates' better interests.

event.text: You don't bother engaging the slaver.
"Thanks for your purchase! May your paths be blessed by whatever stupid plant god these things believe in!"
"Thanks for your purchase! May your paths be blessed by whatever stupid plant god these things believe in!"

event.name: ORCHID_SLAVER_CARETAKER_FAIL
event.text: The slavers watch your Orchid's signing in bored bemusement. "Yeah, yeah, that's great and all, but I missed the part where I was supposed to care. I'm not in this business because I give a damn about morals, if you didn't notice. If you're not going to buy something, get lost."
If you can't convince these slavers to end their trade, then you'll forcefully end it yourself.

choice.text: Change your mind and buy a slave.

event.text: You've wasted enough time here.

To your surprise, your Orchid's message seems to touch the pirates. Or maybe not... seems they're just annoyed. "Jeez, okay! I get it, you're people too, bla bla bla. I know the gist. If I'm rude you'll just kill me. I've met Renegades before. Just take the damn plant and leave me alone." The slavers unshackle one of the Orchids and send them your way. Your Caretaker sees to it they adjust to their newfound freedom.

To your surprise, your Orchid's message seems to touch the pirates. Or maybe not... seems they're just annoyed. "Jeez, okay! I get it, you're people too, bla bla bla. I know the gist. If I'm rude you'll just kill me. I've met Renegades before. Just take the damn plant and leave me alone." The slavers unshackle one of the Orchids and send them your way. Your Caretaker sees to it they adjust to their newfound freedom.

event.name: ORCHID_INSULT
event.text: You are surprised to find a Kleptocracy vessel here, considering the Slugs have few connections to the Gathering. The Slugs are requesting to communicate using an encrypted channel.

choice.text: Agree to talk with the Slugs.

event.text: "Greetingsss, mossst disssgussssting and rotund one. We've been looking for sssuch a fine ssspecimen for a century. You are truly the ugliessst being in the galaxy and dessserve to be embalmed and shown in a mussseum. I can only wonder what your mother looksss like."

choice.text: We won't suffer such insults! Attack!

event.text: Infuriated by this sudden and uncalled for barrage of insults, you open fire. "Haha! Not only are you fat, but you're sssstupid too!" The Slug captain sends a distress message to the nearby Orchid planet claiming to be attacked by pirates. To your surprise, the Orchids on the nearby planet activate their security systems and lock onto your ship! Damn Slugs.

choice.text: (Signal Diluter) Block any distress signals the Slug might make, and attack!

event.text: You fire at the Slug ship and they immediately respond with evasive maneuvers. The Slug captain sends a distress message to the nearby Orchid planet claiming to be attacked by pirates, but it fails to go through. Their initial plan failed, the Slugs have no choice but to fight you on their own.

Nights knocks you away from the console and grabs the mic. "Awww, that'ssss adorable. I ssssee where thissss sssscheme issss going from a mile away - you're professssional victimssss! Too fragile and inssssecure to fight your own battlessss, sssso you hide behind a bunch of flowerssss. You're the mosssst ssssad and pathetic losssserssss I could even imagine. And as long assss we're making assssumptionssss about each other'ssss motherssss, I'm going to guessss by that misssserable look on your ugly mug that you've never actually made yourssss proud."

After hanging up, Nights immediately gets into a shuttle and boards the enemy ship, which has been dead silent the whole time. When he comes back, the shuttle is carrying a large amount of scrap. He chuckles as he dumps it in the cargo hold.

Your Slug turns to the others, dons a pair of shades, and simply states "Couldn't be worssse than your mother after I annihilated her in bed lasssst night." Shocked and outraged, the Slug captain has no idea how to respond. Eventually, in utter humiliation, he concedes and offers surrender.

choice.text: (Tony Sr.) Tony asks to speak with them.

event.text: Tony snaps a picture of the lead Slug, then begins groveling and crying in front of the camera. You and the Slugs are speechless as you watch Tony wail, until his phone buzzes and he immediately snaps back to his usual self. "Thanks for giving my assistants time to look you up. I'd insult your mother, but it'd feel mean, knowing how decrepit her apartment complex on your homeworld is. It'd be a shame if someone made her problems worse by buying the place and having it bulldozed. So why don't you cut your losses and thank me for the warning?" The Slugs toss some scrap your way and jump away, leaving you to worry about what information your crewmate might have against you.

choice.text: Close communications and leave the system.

event.text: You ignore the Slugs, knowing this is most probably a trick.

event.name: ORCHID_FIELD_NORMAL
event.text: A vast beautiful field of flowers lays on the nearby planet. A stunning view of flowers scattered across miles and miles.

choice.text: Pick some flowers, maybe you can sell them.

event.text: As you and your crew begin to cheerfully pluck some flowers from the sunny field, an Orchid ship descends from the sky, their crew in tears. "Monsters! You slaughter our children!"
While still utterly mortified, the Orchids at least are willing to let you leave. They insist you give back all of the flowers you picked and then demand you leave at once.

choice.text: Double down and take the corpses back with you.

event.text: As you lug the gigantic pile of flowers back with you, the sobbing Orchids turn furious. "You bastards! You will pay for this!"

choice.text: Pick some flowers, maybe you can sell them.

event.text: As you move to pick some flowers, Mayeb blocks your path. She looks more pissed off than you have ever seen her.

choice.text: Pick some flowers, maybe you can sell them.
Pick some flowers, maybe you can sell them.
(Orchid Crew) Your Orchid waves their vines frantically, warning you not to do it.

event.text: Your Orchid informs you the field is filled with young Orchid children who have not yet developed mobility. You realise you were nearly about to commit genocide and decide against it.

A strange insidious thought takes over your mind, and acting purely on instinct you raise the weapons and fire them at the field, to the shock and horror of the Orchids observing you. However, rather than decimating the field, the flowers are suddenly transformed into fully grown Orchids. Immediately, the onset of a mid-life crisis drives the field into madness before they are promptly turned back into wailing and barely developed baby flowers, their minds forever turned to mush by a sudden rush of memories and experiences of their adult selves that have yet to even be. Uncertain of what even just happened (and terrified you'll do the same to them), the field's owners simply demand you leave.

A strange insidious thought takes over your mind, and acting purely on instinct you raise the weapons and fire them at the field, to the shock and horror of the Orchids observing you. However, rather than decimating the field, the flowers are suddenly transformed into fully grown Orchids. Though a part of you expects this sudden transformation to be temporary, they remain in their adult forms. Unfortunately, there isn't quite enough room in the field for all of the newly grown Orchids, and you are forced to accept a large number of them on your ship.

Though it's not fertilizer in the traditional sense, the nanobots stimulate the growth of the flowers. The Orchid Caretakers of the field seem to take notice of this and thank you for your generosity, though they advise you not to provide "unsolicited growth stimulation" to other people's children in the future.

Your crew erupts into a fit of maniac laughter as the field is set ablaze. The Orchid Caretakers watching over the field are absolutely horrified, and a Praetor swoops in to stop your act of genocide!

choice.text: You can't seem to get ahold of your Lost Sun.
We have better things to do.

event.text: You ignore the flowers and carry on with your mission.

event.name: ORCHID_FIELD_SECURE
event.text: As you approach the nearby planet which seems to contain a large field of flowers, you're stopped by an incredibly well armed station. "Stop right there! I don't care who you are or what your reason for being here is. This is a high security zone under protection by the Praetorian. You must leave."

The Floral sighs. "We've heard news from other realities that some sicko Renegades have been making a habit of going into our fields and massacring our children. It's become an epidemic, and the Gathering has authorized maximum force in protecting our children now. The SPS has been established to ensure no one else can commit these heinous crimes again."

choice.text: Fight the station to access the planet.

event.text: "Are you KIDDING me? Kader, sound the alarms! We've got another one on our hands!"
If Renegades have really been doing stuff like this, you don't want to be anything like them. You decide to leave.
You don't want to mess with whatever is going on here. You decide to leave as soon as possible.

event.name: ORCHID_FIELD_SECURE_WIN
event.text: With the station out of the way you descend to the planet below. The Orchid Caretakers running the place are terrified at the sight of you, pleading you to spare the children.

Despite your crew's reservations, you order them to pick the flowers anyways. The Caretakers try to pull you away but to no avail as you gun down anyone who gets in your way. Satisfied with your maniacal efforts, you return to the ship with piles of corpses in tow. The word Renegade will surely become a vile insult to anyone here who witnessed this event.
As you move to pick some flowers, Mayeb blocks your path. She looks more pissed off than you have ever seen her.

choice.text: We've done enough, let's just go.

event.text: While at least you didn't go all of the way, it's hard to pretend this won't continue to negatively reinforce the bad reputation of Renegades across the Multiverse.

event.name: IVAR_PROTECTING_THE_KIDS
event.text: You feel something small hit the back of your head. You turn around and find Ivar staring at you, a bottle of wine in one vine and his spear at the ready in the other. He takes a massive swig of his drink and then wipes his mouth. "You know, I consider myself a well-humored fellow. I take things in stride. I laugh at dark jokes, I let mean comments slide off, I let people ridicule and look down on me with reasonably thick skin. I mean hey, I'm in politics, aren't I?" He laughs humorlessly. "But this is crossing the line. I'm going to have to ask you to step away from the children. If you dare touch them, we're going to have a problem." Ivar takes another drink. His teeth clench menacingly as he addresses you again. "Got it?"
Ivar relaxes. "Don't make me get serious again, Captain. I hate being serious."

choice.text: Continue trying to pluck the flowers.

event.text: You feel a sharp pain as Ivar's spear strikes true. You double over in pain onto the floor, blood seeping out from your uniform. "I tried to warn you, captain. Don't worry, I hear the Gathering's prisons have an excellent track record of patching up wounds."
You realize that, in a daze, you may have imagined what just happened. Ivar is still right in front of you, waiting for your response to his implicit ultimatum. Will you really go through with it?
Ivar relaxes. "Don't make me get serious again, Captain. I hate being serious."

You feel a sharp pain as Ivar's spear strikes true. You double over in pain onto the floor, blood seeping out from your uniform. "I tried to warn you, captain. Don't worry, I hear the Gathering's prisons have an excellent track record of patching up wounds."

choice.text: Continue trying to pluck the flowers.

event.text: "Yeah, I don't think so." Ivar pins you up against the wall with his spear and orders your own crew to take you to the brig. To your surprise the crew actually obeys, grabbing you and dragging you away. As you demand an explanation for their mutiny, Ivar turns around and smiles. "Silly Renegade. Did you forget that I'm a politician? I'm on a first name basis with the rest of the crew. I wanted to be friends with you too, but I'm afraid I don't associate with child-murderers."
You realize that, in a daze, you may have imagined what just happened. Ivar is still right in front of you, waiting for your response to his implicit ultimatum. Will you really go through with it?
Ivar relaxes. "Don't make me get serious again, Captain. I hate being serious."

"Yeah, I don't think so." Ivar pins you up against the wall with his spear and orders your own crew to take you to the brig. To your surprise the crew actually obeys, grabbing you and dragging you away. As you demand an explanation for their mutiny, Ivar turns around and smiles. "Silly Renegade. Did you forget that I'm a politician? I'm on a first name basis with the rest of the crew. I wanted to be friends with you too, but I'm afraid I don't associate with child-murderers."

event.name: TY_EREL_PROTECTING_THE_KIDS
event.text: A strong vine wraps around your arm. You're being held still by Ty E'Rel. Although his expression is as neutral as ever, he seems more menacing than usual. "Captain, I will not allow you to harm these children."
Ty E'Rel nods. You lurch away from him as he loosens his grip. You can still feel him staring daggers at you as you order your ship away from the planet.

choice.text: Struggle free and continue trying to pluck the flowers.

event.text:
You feel his vines begin to constrict around your neck. No matter how hard you fight, you can't break free. You begin to drift away from consciousness.
In what feels like a moment later, you awaken with a headache. The ship is no longer anywhere near the planet. You've lost quite a bit of time, and you won't be able to stay here much longer. Ty E'Rel is keeping his distance for now, but things are likely to be tense from here on out.

choice.text: Order your crew to help you.

event.text: You try to get your crew to intervene on your behalf, but they seem unwilling. Ty E'Rel shakes his head. "I've had a discussion with them already. The rest of the crew will no longer follow your orders unless you agree to leave the children alone." Eventually, your crew pilots the ship away from the fields while Ty E'Rel holds you down. Once you're clear, he lets go, but you can tell the crew no longer respects you as they once might have - if they ever did.

choice.text: Try to get a word in.
Wait for her to calm down.
Nod to try and appease her.

event.text: "Fine. I've made my point. Now what do you have to say for yourself?"

choice.text: I've heard you out, but I'm still going to do it.

event.text: Mayeb puts her vines on her hips. "I don't think so! There's more that I have to say, and you're going to listen to me until you learn your lesson."
Mayeb folds her vines. "Say it more clearly. What are you apologizing for?"

choice.text: I'm sorry for thoughtlessly endangering the lives of children.

event.text: "Good. Now let's get the hell out of here."

textList.name: MAYEB_CHILDREN_1
textList.text: "Sit down and listen to me. Those are our children you're threatening. I'm not just going to stand by and do nothing. Surely you didn't think that I - a flower defined by her desire to protect the helpless - would just let you get away with bringing harm to helpless sprouts, even if they weren't sapient."

"I am not going to back down here, so you'd better listen good, Captain. These children deserve to have a long and healthy healthy life, as any child does in this multiverse. Sapient children often have a long period of time in which they are vulnerable in order to properly form their mental faculties, and Orchids are no exception. That you would prey upon something which is so helpless speaks to your callous disregard for life."

"Who do you think you are, that you can waltz in and order the deaths of children? Not only have they done nothing to hurt you, they wouldn't even be capable of trying. They're children, for Rt'Lak's sake. There's nothing that their deaths could possibly serve - haven't we got more important things to be doing anyway?"

textList.name: MAYEB_CHILDREN_2
textList.text: "Shut up. I'm not done yet. Were you not a child, Captain? Do you not understand the fragility and volatility of youth? Do you not witness the long term scars that people bear from childhood? It's not simply a matter of prioritization of the needs of the youth over the needs of the elder, those wounds of childhood are so much more potent. Is that something you want on your conscience?"

"SHUSH! I'm still talking. Is it that you don't respect us, or that you don't respect people who are younger than you in general? Is this perhaps a species thing, or are you incapable of empathy for those who are less developed than you? I'm genuinely curious - if these looked like little human sprouts, would that stay your heartless amusement?"

"Zip it, chowderhead! You purport to be a savior of the Federation. Well, start acting like one! No monster who commands the deaths of children could ever be worthy of saving anyone. Commit whatever garden variety war atrocities you want, but I insist that you leave the children out of it!"

textList.name: MAYEB_CHILDREN_3
textList.text: "You must be a very sick person to even consider something so vile, so cruel, so heartless. No, I'm not saying you are irredeemably so, but you must take proper stock of yourself if you are ever to settle down after your adventures through the multiverse. Or... have your forsaken your humanity in this vocation, that you plan to die in the stars, never giving a damn about any who do not serve to benefit you?"

"You still have the opportunity to do the right thing here. The vile act has not been committed yet. These children can still live a long and fruitful life free of the cruel machinations of a multiversal vagabond. Turn off your weapons and we can all move along and... well, I won't forget this, but I'll let it slide."

"You might be an accomplished Captain. You might be capable of facing off with the most dangerous threats in all of reality. Or you might not. It doesn't matter to me. I will advocate for these children until my dying breath, so you turn this ship around and get back to doing your job."

event.name: ORCHID_THEFT
event.text: A distressed band of Florals hails you. Though it appears most live a mute lifestyle, one Orchid is able to communicate vocally. "Please help! An Auto-ship has come and stolen our children! Please rescue them!"
You track down the Auto-ship, and it appears it has not yet left the system. It loops a single message, "GIVE ME THE PLANT", and attacks you!

You give the corpses over to the Auto-ship, which it scans then accepts. "Plant has been given. Thank you for your contributions to the Rebel Xeno-Identification Project. Accept this monetary compensation for your offering."
You apologize and mute the Orchids.

event.name: ORCHID_SACRIFICE
event.text: A small fleet of Lost Sun ships orbit a small uninhabited planet. You intercept communication between two of the ships and hear them mention something about an execution.

You pilot closer to the planet's surface. In the center of a large tent is a massive bonfire with an Orchid Praetor tied up! A large brutish Rockman stands waving his hands and speaking loudly to a cheering crowd of fellow Lost Suns. "The Gathering has made it clear where they stand on the side of liberty! They claim to be allies of the Federation and purveyors of peace, yet they continue to forge good-mannered relations with the Elders in the face of their own tyranny! Today we make an example of how the Lost Suns treat such indignation!"

You send in a team of crew to rush in and cut down the Orchid before the Lost Suns can drop them into the fire. You rush back to the ship with a horde of angry Rocks and an attack ship in hot pursuit.

choice.text: (Floral Crew) Demand the prisoners are freed.

event.text: "Haha! The pitiful plant creature wishes to fight for its kin! You work aboard a Federation mercenary vessel, yet you defend the actions of people who have done everything but defend your virtues! Get out of here at once!" You don't have time to free the Praetor or protest, because a Lost Sun vessel is dispatched to chase you away!

Your Commando speaks with the other Lost Suns, eventually coming to an understanding that perhaps massacring the Federation's allies isn't a good idea. The Lost Suns untie the Orchid Praetor, who thanks you and offers to work aboard your ship.
"M'am! I- I am s-so so so sorry. I uhh, uh, I was just doing my duty for the glory of the Lost Suns! Please, don't discharge me. I will free the Orchid immediately."
"What... what are these. You have given me corpses? Of children? What... what is wrong with you. We're here to make an example of injustice, not of child slaughter. Get the hell out of here!"
There really is no worse time to go making enemies with the Lost Suns than now. You pull away from the planet.
If the Lost Suns are performing some sort of sacrifice here, you want no part in it.

event.name: ORCHID_ELITEDUEL
event.text: You're surprised to find not one but two elite ships squaring off at this beacon! A Lanius Welder and an Orchid Praetor have entered a duel, and you find yourself caught in the middle of it!
You intercept the Lanius ship and prepare for combat.
You intercept the Orchid ship and prepare for combat.

choice.text: Fly the hell away from here!

event.text: You power up the engines and fly far away from the two ships.

event.name: GARDEN_DUEL_LANIUS_DEFEAT
event.text: You've defeated the Lanius elites, and now the bounty of their ship is yours.
The Orchid silently nods to you in thanks, and gives you a Kernel weapon from their ship as payment.

event.name: GARDEN_DUEL_ORCHID_DEFEAT
event.text: You've defeated the Orchid elites, and now the bounty of their ship is yours.
"Are debt, paying." The Lanius send over some random materials.

event.name: DISTRESS_ORCHID_NOTPIRATES
event.text: A damaged Orchid panics when you jump in. "So you pirates have returned to destroy us? We will not go peacefully like last time!"

event.name: DISTRESS_ORCHID_WEEDS
event.text: An Orchid ship frantically hails you. "Federation, help! Our station has become overrun with massive man-eating weeds!"

choice.text: Send a team to assist! Massive man-eating weeds are no laughing matter.
It appears you lack bodies to throw at the bloodthirsty plants.

event.text: Plants and fire are a combination that don't mix well. The Orchid personnel evacuate, and your Goul sets the station ablaze. Once the weeds are gone for certain, the station is vented and the Orchids give you a brand new Kernel weapon for your creative problem solving.

Plants and fire are a combination that don't mix well. The Orchid personnel evacuate, and your Lost Sun sets the station ablaze. Once the weeds are gone for certain, the station is vented and the Orchids give you a brand new Kernel weapon for your creative problem solving.

Your crew suits up and board the station, firing on the weeds and quickly taking them down. Once they are gone for certain, the station is vented, and the Orchids give you a brand new Kernel weapon for your ruthless but efficient problem solving.

Your crewmember arms up and board the station, easily coming up with a plan. Using a combination of their senses and specialised hunting gear, the abominations are felled in a decisive strike, and the Orchids give you a brand new Kernel weapon for your ruthless but efficient problem solving.

Irwin boards the station, easily coming up with a plan. Using his knowledge of past battles against equally twisted creatures, the abominations are swiftly dealt with, and the Orchids give you a brand new Kernel weapon for your ruthless but efficient problem solving.

Plants and fire are a combination that don't mix well. The Orchid personnel evacuate, and you set the station ablaze. Once the weeds are gone for certain, the station is vented and the Orchids give you a brand new Kernel weapon for your creative problem solving.

There's no reason why your weapon wouldn't be effective against these deadly weeds. The Orchid personnel evacuate, and you fire upon the station. Once the weeds are gone for certain, the station is vented and the Orchids give you a brand new Kernel weapon for your creative problem solving.

The murderbots will rid the station of anything living. The Orchid personnel evacuate, and you flood the station with the deadly nanobots. Once the weeds are gone for certain, the nanobots are called back and the Orchids give you a brand new Kernel weapon for your creative problem solving.

The Shell's toxic gas can kill nearly any organic matter quickly. The Orchid personnel evacuate, and you flood the station with the deadly gas. Once the weeds are gone for certain, the station is vented and the Orchids give you a brand new Kernel weapon for your creative problem solving.

choice.text: (Shell Guardian Crew) Have your Shell Guardian handle the weeds.

event.text: Your Shell has little fear of the deadly weeds, having such a hard exterior. Once the weeds are rid of, the Orchid personnel reward you with a new Kernel weapon for handling the situation so quickly.

choice.text: (Boarding Drone) Send your drone to handle the weeds.

event.text: You pull up alongside the station and release the drone through the airlock. Within a short time the majority of the creatures are dead, with only a little collateral damage. The Orchid personnel express their most sincere gratitude and offer you a Kernel weapon.
You can't risk fighting deadly aliens on every station you find. You prepare to jump.

Your crew board the station, and find a massive carnivorous plant reaching out to grab them. Fortunately, plants (as well as most other creatures) don't fare well against laser fire. Once the weeds have been driven back, the Orchids thank you.

The station is eerily silent, as your crew wander the hallways. Suddenly, a massive tentacle and toothed petals erupt out of one of the vents snatching up your crew and dragging them away in a bloody mess. Horrified, your crew evacuate immediately.

removeCrew.text: You take a hopeful trip to the Clone Bay, and to your relief a clone is already prepared for the lost crewmember.

event.name: DISTRESS_ORCHID_JUNGLE
event.text: The distress signal is originating from a stunningly beautiful forest planet with a developed Orchid outpost not too far away. You don't see any ships in need of distress.

You scope out the area around the outpost. It doesn't take long to find the true origins of the distress beacon, a damaged distress beacon laying a few miles from two ships, one Orchid, and the other Rebel.

It appears the Rebels have taken the Orchid ship, which was trying to return to the outpost, hostage. The Orchid ship's relay systems have been damaged beyond repair and the Rebels have lined up the Orchids firing squad style. "Alright, we got the last of the plant things. We gonna shoot 'em now, or take them back to the stronghold and make a big display out of it?"
You arm the weapons and charge the Rebel ship. The officers scatter back to their ship to defend themselves.

choice.text: (Upg. Weapons) Fire a shot straight into the Rebel ship.

event.text: One shot straight into their engines is all it takes to cripple the Rebel ship. Now helpless, the Rebels surrender and scatter into the forest, leaving their ship to you.

choice.text: (Mind Control) Turn the Rebels against each other.

event.text: The Rebel commander whips around and blasts one of the other soldiers in the chest. Confused, the rest of the Rebels enter a firefight with each other, until every single last of of them has managed to kill each other, leaving no one to guard their ship.

choice.text: (Mind Affecting Weapon) Turn the Rebels against each other.

event.text: Chaos erupts as each of the Rebels hit by your weapon draws their weapons and begin a violent free for all. The bloodbath continues until every single last of of them has managed to kill each other, leaving no one to guard their ship.
You can't risk your primary mission to save a couple Orchids. You feel guilty, but you know you had no part in this crime anyways.
Whoever they were, they probably got help already. There's no need to stick around.
The Orchids are grateful for your assistance. Most offer to be dropped off back at the outpost, but one sticks behind on your ship, hoping you'll be able to protect it from the Rebels in the future.
The Orchid give you one of the Kernel weapons from their damaged ship, no longer needing it now that they can return to the outpost in peace.

event.name: DISTRESS_ORCHID_ROCK_CRASH
event.text: On the nearby planet is the crash-site of a Rock vessel, heavily damaged, but their distress beacon still functioning.
You have no interest in helping the Rockmen.

To your surprise the crew is a Rock outcast! They explain they fled from the Rock Homeworlds after their banishment and expected to be welcomed into Orchid territory... only for a group of maddened, parasite ridden Orchids to attack their ship and nearly destroy it!
You pry open the doors of the Rock ship only to find the butchered corpse of a mossy Rockman and several irate, parasite ridden Orchids!

event.name: DISTRESS_ORCHID_EMPTY_SHIP
event.text: A distress signal is coming from an Orchid ship, drifting far away from common interstellar routes. You try to communicate but there is no answer.

choice.text: There's no one to send to board that ship.
(Adv. Sensors) Fetch the ship's security logs first.

event.text: You have no need to communicate with the ship.

You board the ship to find the aftermath of an explosion and the resulting inferno. You can only surmise what was the reason of the accident. Most of equipment is charred and burnt, and there is no one alive, but you still manage to find some useful scrap and resources.

The only person alive on the ship is a dehydrated Orchid. The ship ran out of water and life support systems broke down. After irrigation, the resilient Orchid is rejuvenated and restored to full consciousness.

The boarding team heads into the ship to look for survivors. After a while, your crew falls into an uncontrollable rage. They are returned back to the ship as soon as possible, but one of the crewmembers was affected so strongly that they went mad upon coming back to the ship.

choice.text: (Orchid Crew) Let the Orchid calm the madman.

event.text: The Orchid sprays soothing pollen, and the madman gradually comes to their senses. The whole team sighs in relief.

choice.text: (Mantis Pheromones) Treat the madman with pheromones.

event.text: As soon as a fresh portion of pheromones enters the crewmember's body, they get better.

choice.text: (Adv. Medbay) Try to synthesise a cure with your Medbay.

event.text: You desperately try to scan the affected crewmember with your Medbay. The Medbay struggles to figure out the cause of their condition, but produces a cure all the same. You quickly apply it to the crewmember, and fortunately it seems to work properly.
There is no other way but to kill the poor fellow.

The security footage shows the aftermath of an explosion and the resulting inferno. You can only surmise what was the reason of the accident. Most of equipment is charred and burnt, and there is no one alive, but you still manage to find some useful scrap and resources.

The only person alive on the ship is a dehydrated Orchid. The ship ran out of water and life support systems broke down. After irrigation, the resilient Orchid is rejuvenated and restored to full consciousness.

event.name: DISTRESS_ORCHID_COLONY_FIRE
event.text: A distress signal is coming from the surface of a planet near the beacon. A wildfire is spreading towards a small Orchid colony which lacks the resources to extinguish it or evacuate in time.

choice.text: Help to evacuate as many civilians as you can.

event.text: The ecosystem on the Orchid planet is so vulnerable to fire that even your whole crew isn't enough to save the Orchid colony in time. You succeeded in helping more hardy individuals but most of the Orchid seeds and babies are lost to the fire.

choice.text: This incident is no concern to us.

event.text: There's nothing you can do. Your crew is upset but you prepare to jump.

choice.text: (Fire Suppression) Use the augmentation to save the colony.

event.text: The Fire Suppression system is deployed in the colony from your ship, and helps tremendously in holding back wildfires in key points while all the living Orchids evacuate. One of the Orchids is so impressed by your performance that they ask to join your crew.

choice.text: (Mantis Pheromones) Use the augmentation to speed up the evacuation.

event.text: Affected by pheromones, your crew and the Orchid civilians move a lot faster, leaving no one behind. After the colony is evacuated, one of the Orchids is so impressed by your performance that they ask to join your crew.

choice.text: (Crystal Crew) Block wildfire spreading to buy some time.

event.text: Your crewmember erects giant crystalline walls in mere seconds, and within minutes a defense barrier is in place to restrict the fire. The flames are slowed down and all of the colony manages to escape to safety. One of the Orchids is so impressed by your performance that they ask to join your crew.

choice.text: (Lockdown Bomb) Block wildfire spreading to win some time.

event.text: The bomb is used to erect giant crystalline walls in mere seconds. The flames are slowed down and all of the colony manages to escape to safety. One of the Orchids is so impressed by your performance that they ask to join your crew.

choice.text: (Drone Reactor Booster) Deploy superior drones to help. [-2|]

event.text: The onboard drones are reprogrammed and used for help. They carry seeds, babies, and valuables, put out fires and save the day in the end. One of the Orchids is so impressed by your performance that they ask to join your crew.

event.name: ORCHID_ZOLTAN_QUEST_START
event.text: An unarmed Zoltan ship greets you. "Our vessel is on a diplomatic mission to the Orchid worlds. We would like to hire you to go ahead of us and offer a small gift to one of the nearby Orchid colonies to herald our arrival."

The Zoltans deliver a box containing a gift to Orchids. The package contains a replica of a Zoltan spaceship of an unusual shape, which vibrates rapidly, radiating light and heat. It's made from high quality metals and very pleasant to look at.
After you've received the gift, the Zoltans transfer over the coords for your destination.

You inspect the device and quickly discover that it's actually a Duskbringer-made bomb in disguise! This was a trap! The bomb seems to have been set to deploy a message revealing it to be a Rebel ploy. This must have been some complex coordinated effort between the Duskbringers and Rebels to sabotage your mission.
As soon as the unarmed ship realizes you haven't fallen for their trap, a Duskbringer escort reveals itself and attacks!

choice.text: (Duskbringer Crew) Your Duskbringer recognizes something strange with the device...

event.text: Your Duskbringer inspects the device and quickly discovers that it's actually a bomb in disguise! This was a trap! The bomb seems to have been set to deploy a message revealing it to be a Rebel ploy. This must have been some complex coordinated effort between the Duskbringers and Rebels to sabotage your mission.
As soon as the unarmed ship realizes you haven't fallen for their trap, a Duskbringer escort reveals itself and attacks!
You don't have time for diplomatic missions.

event.name: ORCHID_ZOLTAN_QUEST_FINISH

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: A Zoltan asked you to deliver a gift to a Gathering settlement.

event.text: You arrive at the co-ordinates to find the Orchid settlement. They welcome you in.
You don't mention the sculpture to the Orchids. You shake 'tendrils' with them and leave. This sculpture will likely sell for a bit of scrap.

You lamely toss the dead children at the feet of the Orchids. They stare unblinking at you for a few moments, then begin to scream. You run back to the ship followed by one of their strongest vessels.

You hand over the sculpture of the Zoltan ship. The Orchids are fascinated by it, and thank you. Though the gift was from the Zoltans, the Orchids seem to credit you mostly and offer a large portion of scrap and ammunition.

You hand over the sculpture of the Zoltan ship. The Orchids are fascinated by it, and thank you. Though the gift was from the Zoltans, the Orchids seem to credit you mostly and offer a large portion of scrap and ammunition.

As you hand over the statue, it begins to vibrate with greater intensity. A message briefly plays, "You will regret having sided with the Federation, filthy weed freaks! Glory to the Rebellion!", and then immediately explodes! The Orchid settlement is decimated and your ship takes some damage, but that's not the worst of it. The Orchids blame you for the attack and send one of their remaining ships to attack you!

As you hand over the statue, it begins to vibrate with greater intensity. A message briefly plays, "Filthy weed freaks! This was a trap set by the Rebellion! Prepare to die!", and then immediately explodes! The Orchid settlement is decimated and your ship takes some damage, but that's not the worst of it. The Orchids blame you for the attack and send one of their remaining ships to attack you!

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_PIRATE_ORCHID
textList.text: The Gathering has been ramping up internal security heavily in recent history, but still pirates always manage to slip through the cracks. Get ready for battle!
Gathering sectors are known hotspots for wealthy Zoltan and Rock traders. Of course, such abundant wealth serves as a honeypot for the flocks of pirates looking to scavenge a pretty penny.

"Honestly captain, I'm no pirate. I'm a warrior for the free market!" A pirate captain smiles smugly at you. "Just... a very, very free market. These flower communards though? They don't know a single thing about how money works! I'm doing you all a favor by cleaning them out. Unfortunately, you're in my way. Gotta get you out of it."
You gaze out the window at an overgrown Orchid planet when a pirate jumps in out of nowhere. It appears conflict is inevitable.

"I'm sick of these plants! They're boring! I go to a tavern looking for a good time and instead I just find a bunch of monks throwing me hand signals! God, it's driving me mad! Mad enough to kill someone!" The pirate blinks when he notices you nearby. "Hey... speaking of someone to kill!"

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_ROCK_ORCHID
textList.text: The Theocracy will make allies with any nation willing to accept the Chrysolic faith within their borders. The Gathering has been very receptive to this faith, and unfortunately a heavy flow of Theocracy ships that aren't quite so friendly to you keep finding their way here!

"You know nothing of faith, Renegade! Look around you and witness the holy alliance of sillicon and leaves! When the Federation crumbles, the Gathering will not mourn your death, instead they will join us in holy matrimony! Tremble before my crusading might as I vanquish your evil from this place!"

The first contact between the Florals and the Theocracy happened many centuries ago, but it was the beginning of the Gathering's interstellar colonization projects. Ever since, relations between them and the Theocracy have been very solid. As solid, perhaps, as the hull of the irate Rock vessel barreling towards you.
A babbling Rock captain, drunk on Floral-made beer and perhaps some narcotics too, starts shouting insults at you and raises his weapons to attack!

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_REBEL_ORCHID
textList.text: A Rebel vessel approaches cautiously, trying to figure out your purpose here. "This sector belongs to the Rebellion, and always has! The Federation will respect our claim to the lands of all inferior species or we will annihilate you like we should have during the Civil War!"

"You know the thing I like about the Orchids, captain?" A Rebel captain takes a whiff of his cigar and frowns at you. "They don't scream when I kill them. Makes it easy to give the orders to shoot, 'cause I know my men don't have it in them to mow down pleading civilian families when they can hear them. You on the other hand... no matter how much you plead, nothing's going to stop us from painting the walls red with your blood."

"Glory to the Rebellion! Your choice in defending these communist flowers betrays your claims of representing a prosperous galaxy! There is nothing prosperous to be found here!" The Rebel ship's weapons lock onto your hull and conflict becomes unavoidable.
A Rebel vessel, likely sent here to take advantage of the usually non-violent Florals, has identified you as a Federation-hired Renegade and is firing! You have no choice but to defend yourself.

event.name: ORCHID_PIRATE_FRIENDLY_ASB
event.text: A pirate ship worn out by many battles moves in your direction from behind an Orchid planet. An ASB system seems to have been installed on the nearby planet, and if you sent out a distress signal you might be able to take advantage of it!
You send a distress signal, and the Gathering military force stationed at the planet responds immediately and targets the pirate with an Anti-Ship Battery.

You send a distress signal. The Gathering military force stationed at the planet responds after a short delay - by targeting both you and the pirate with an Anti-Ship Battery. Unfortunately for you, they are not oblivious to your crimes.

event.name: ORCHID_CAPTURED_REBEL
event.text: You are surprised to hear the crew of an Orchid ship talk in human language: "Surrender. All nearby worlds are controlled by Rebellion forces. Resistance is futile." From the uneasy movements of the ship, it seems the Rebels have recently taken control of this ship and still aren't used to piloting it. Nevertheless, they lock onto you and attack!

event.name: ORCHID_SUZERAIN_VETERAN
event.text: A Mantis Suzerain, his carapace laden with scars from his ancient past, glares at you through the monitor. "The Federation-Mantis war never ended. I refuse to recognize the treaties... still to this day I, last bastion of glorious decade, continue our work. I will eradicating every last scumling in this galaxy. The flowers are weak. But you... surely you are even weaker."

event.name: CARETAKER_PRAETOR_ARGUMENT
event.text: By the time you reach the beacon, a Praetor seems to have already responded to the distress call. Its origin was a small, brown shuttle - they seem to be discussing something.

"...and maybe this Federation ship can help me. Renegade! It's good timing that you have come. The Praetorian are committing a grievous wrong, one that only the Caretakers of Rt'lak Et are trying to fix!"
The Praetor grumbles. "I am not saying I support what's being done. But the Praetors are preoccupied. With the recent campaign against our border, we cannot afford the infighting. We don't have the resources."

The Caretaker leans in. "The Gathering is forcibly relocating many natives of Rt'lak Et, which will no doubt inflict considerable harm. You need to help us make our case to the Gathering, stand up for those who cannot stand for themselves. None of the other Florals are willing to help."

The Caretaker lets out a sigh. "The Kadahellian Schism began after the Theocracy uplifted us. This allowed us - the Ctl'Yae - to explore until we found Rt'lak Et, our greatest gardenworld. Nowhere else in the known galaxy does such a lush and perfect environment exist for advanced plant life. While we have many garden worlds, Rt'lak Et is special. Our people grow and manufacture our best ships and weapons there. But our government has decided to lower themselves to relocating many species which cannot survive in weaker climates offworld in the name of stepping up weapon production. The long term ecological ramifications could be severe."

event.name: CARETAKER_CHAT
event.text: The Praetor shakes her head. "The Duskbringers believe they can weaken the Federation by burning down our Gardenworlds. For the most part, they had been unsuccessful, as we diverted the majority of our forces to hold the line. Truth be told, for as long as our production gardens are under threat, the Gathering is likely to push for heavier militarization. Unfortunately, one of their number managed to make it into our territory anyway. We can't divert any more ships away from the front lines, which means our ability to chase them is limited. The best we can do is defend our core worlds and hope they don't do much damage."

The Praetor clenches her foliage. "Our listening post at Kat'ar Lek went dark. We had a Praetor stationed there, and they haven't been responding. We don't have the resources to send another right now, and they can destroy most other Floral vessels. If you can take them out, they lose their one foothold in our territory, which we believe will force them to back off. And if this happens, I can certainly convince my government to offer you a ship for your fleet."
The Caretaker adds. "If you want to help us, the first relocation transport is on its way to its destination. I can transmit coordinates so that we can intercept them. Either we can talk some sense into them... or, we might have to get a little aggressive."
"That is a relief. If you can get the invaders off our back, this will ease tensions. And, I give you my word that I will stop any further harm from occurring. We will be waiting."
"Excellent! I was beginning to lose hope. I will follow behind. If we can sort this out, I will offer what I can." The Caretaker indicates the heading of the offending ship into your map.
"Wow, really? That's... unexpected." The Praetor blinks. "Here are the coordinates of the outpost."
"I worry you are stretching yourself thin." The Caretaker shakes his head. "Here's the location of the transport. Much obliged."

choice.text: We don't have time to help either.

event.text: Both Orchids make annoyed noises. "Why did you get involved if you weren't going to help?" "What a waste of time."
The Orchids can probably work this out between each other.

event.name: GARDEN_INVASION_QUEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: A Praetor has tasked you with tracking down a powerful ship.

event.text: You arrive to find a heavily damaged listening post, as well as a few destroyed and derelict Floral ships. The Duskbringer captain sends a message to taunt you. "The Federation must be desperate to send you after us. We will burn these horrid worlds for the glory of our righteous cause!"

event.name: ORCHID_INVASION_WIN
event.text: The formidable New Order ship falls, leaving you victorious. The Duskbringers let out a final cry as their bodies explode into nothingness. Their ship provides a healthy amount of resources.
You quickly look over all the ships for any survivors, but all you can find are corpses. You collect what you can from the wreckages.

event.name: ORCHID_INVASION_LIFE_SCAN
event.text: You're able to detect a surviving life form on a derelict ship - a dying Praetor scarred badly from an explosion. They won't last long.
You rush the Praetor to your medical facilities just in time to heal their wounds. As they recover enough stamina to talk, they sit up on the bed.

choice.text: Discuss the situation with the Praetor.
(Upg. Clone Bay) Register the Praetor into the clone bay.

event.text: You rush the Praetor to your clone bay just in time. They expire just as the system scans their biological patterns. After a brief moment, the Praetor exits the clone bay in confusion before realizing what just happened.

choice.text: Discuss the situation with the Praetor.

event.text: You send in your medical crew, who patches the dying Praetor up on the spot, successfully saving their life. Your medical crew returns alongside the Praetor.

choice.text: Discuss the situation with the Praetor.

event.text: You send in your medical drone. The drone patches up the Praetor on the spot, successfully saving their life. You send the Praetor a shuttle to make their way to your ship.

choice.text: Discuss the situation with the Praetor.

event.text: Your medical bomb explodes, filling the room with healing nanites, which quickly reverses the damage from the explosion. You send the Praetor a shuttle to make their way to your ship.

choice.text: Discuss the situation with the Praetor.

event.text: The Praetor appears in your teleporter room, completely free of harm. They stand up, confused at what has happened. After a few moments of confusion, they turn to you.

choice.text: Discuss the situation with the Praetor.
Nothing can be done to save this Orchid.

event.text: Unfortunately, you can only watch helplessly as the Orchid passes. You collect what you can from the wreckages.

choice.text: Use the listening station to contact the Orchids.

event.name: ORCHID_INVASION_PRAETOR_SAVED
event.text: "I'm... alive. Thank you, kind Renegade. Bastards took us by surprise. If you don't mind, there's something I want to do. This won't take long." The Praetor takes a shuttle to the listening station and patches it up. It whirrs to life and begins a long-ranged broadcast of the derelict New Order ship. After doing this, the Praetor relaxes. "Anyhow, let me thank you for saving my life. I can offer you the cache lying hidden at this post."

choice.text: The Praetors from the front lines are hailing you.

event.text: "Well done, Renegade! You even rescued one of our soldiers, and for that we are forever grateful. It looks like the Duskbringers won't hold on for much longer. Hopefully this will ease some of the tensions within the gardens. Good luck."

choice.text: Ask the Praetor you rescued if they will accompany you.

event.text: The Praetor returns to your ship. "I owe you my life, Captain."

event.name: ORCHID_INVASION_CONTACT_PRAETORS
event.text: You use the long-ranged communication relays connected to the station to inform the Praetors of your success. "Fantastic work. With luck, they will realize what has happened. Now that their foothold is gone, they will either back off, or make a mistake that we can capitalize upon. As promised, we will send a ship to your hangar."

surrender.text: "Stop! State your demands, and we will end this!"

choice.text: Convince them to turn their ships around and return to Rt'lak Et.

event.name: RELOCATION_SURRENDER
event.text: "You... you're really passionate about this, aren't you? We'll do as you ask. If you can convince the rulership to change their minds, maybe it will be for the best." The escort sighs. "I'm probably going to get demoted for this..."

event.name: ORCHID_RELOCATION_QUEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: A Caretaker wants you to help the plants that are being relocated here.

event.text: As you arrive, you immediately notice a massive Orchid freighter. As you look closer, there is a massive greenhouse taking up most of it - this freighter must be able to carry an entire city's worth of Orchids! Despite its large size, there is only a single Orchid Fighter escorting it. They don't seem to consider you a threat and continue to move along. The Caretaker shuttle that originally tasked you with the request jumps in not long after you do.
The escort responds as the transport stands by. "Greetings, friend of the Federation. What troubles you?"

choice.text: (Ty E'Rel) Inform them that they must turn their ship around.

event.text:
"Ambassador Ty E'Rel?? You came all the way out here for this?"
"I wouldn't stop you if this wasn't important. We must return to Rt'lak Et with these creatures. We can explain more when we arrive."
"A-are you sure? This freighter is extremely expensive to move and maintain... wouldn't it be better if we waited here if there's any uncertainty?"
Ty E'Rel snorts. "That's a stupid question."

Ivar pounds the console. "Oy! What are you doin' over there?"
"Is that Premier Ivar?"
"You're making a mistake over there! Here I am over in the Confederacy trying to make things a little more joyful, and what do I find on my latest visit to the Gathering? You, making the same mistake we made when you left us! Now turn around, I have some people to give a piece of my mind!"
"But... Mr. Vampweed Premier, this ship is incredibly costly to move and maintain! We can't just-"
"I will help with whatever extra costs are incurred. Just do what I say!" Cowed, the ships begin to turn around.

choice.text: (Positive Orchid Reputation) Convince them to turn back.

event.text: You make a passionate case on behalf of the plants that they are transporting. "Well... you're held in good regard in these parts... But, this freighter is extremely costly to move and maintain. Are you sure you can convince the leadership to change their mind?" You give them your assurance that you'll do your best. They seem to accept this and turn their ships around.

You make a passionate case on behalf of the plants that they are transporting. The escort interrupts. "Sorry, but we have our orders. If you've been listening to those Caretakers, especially Mayeb, please just forget about it. We know what we're doing."

choice.text: Tell them you won't leave them alone until they change their mind.

event.text: "Stand down, Renegade. No need to escalate this. I'm going to ask you to leave."
"I didn't want to have to do this, but you leave me no choice!" The Orchid ship warms its weapons.
You stand down. The ships eventually jump away without contacting you again.
"Was that really the best you could do...?" The Caretaker sighs. "I suppose it was too much to ask that you show a little more backstem."
You apologize. The Orchid responds cheerfully. "No problem. Glad you understand."
"Was that really the best you could do...?" The Caretaker sighs. "I suppose it was too much to ask that you show a little more backstem."
The escort is caught offguard by your sudden attack. "You madman! Why are you attacking a garden convoy?"

event.name: ORCHID_RELOCATION_CONTACT_SHUTTLE
event.text: "Well, you managed to hold up your end of the bargain. I don't think I can do this alone... would you accompany us to Rt'lak Et? If you do, I will devote myself to your cause." The Caretaker gives the reward as promised.

choice.text: Accept the Caretaker and the coordinates.

event.text: "You won't regret this, Renegade. I will serve you faithfully. Now let's hurry to Rt'lak Et!"
"I appreciate what you've done for us anyway. Good luck, Renegade."

event.name: ORCHID_NONSAPIENT_RESCUE
event.text: With the escort vanquished, the helpless freighter immediately hails you. You respond as your crew begin to salvage the escort. "We surrender! Please, we will set a course back home. Just let us live!"

event.name: GARDEN_WORLD_CRUISER_QUEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: This is the location of Rt'lak Et.

event.text: You draw closer to Rt'lak Et, the greatest of the Orchid Gardenworlds. The alien infrastructure of the planet showcases the most breathtaking, impressive biotechnology available anywhere in the galaxy. The Caretaker sends you the precise latitude and longitude that concerns your mission. As you approach, it's clear there's a standoff: a small contingent of Caretakers are standing against a massive Orchid Elite ship. Nearby, there is also an Orchid station overseeing the conflict.

choice.text: Get closer and tune into the communications between the Orchid factions.

event.text:
"We've had enough of your alarmism, Mayeb. That parasite must be eroding your mind."
"It's not alarmism! If you keep removing so many species from the planet, not only is it immoral, but it could do long-term harm to the ecosystem. And don't you dare call P'Erpah a 'parasite'. She is my sister."
"Your sister? And yet, you are the only one who can 'hear' her. Perhaps we should send you off for 'treatment'."
"If you're done personally attacking us, maybe you could respond to the points I'm making."

The Praetor ship turns to yours. "These are internal affairs of the Ctl'Yae. The Federation must not interfere."
A new voice comes over the comm, from the station. "Calm yourself, Praetor Bralmeb. I am Counsellor Pael, mediating this dispute. Although, the decision's been finalized. We are simply trying to convince Mayeb that she needs to stand down."

choice.text: Try to convince them to listen to Mayeb.

event.text:
You begin to make your case, but as you do, you are interrupted by the arrival of the freighter that you intercepted.
Bralmeb is astonished. "What?? You've returned so soon?? What's the meaning of this?" He mutes, and you're greeted with a few moments of radio silence as the freighter privately fills in the Praetors.
Mayeb, meanwhile, takes the opportunity to contact you. "Renegade, I appreciate your help in this matter, but I urge you to try and defuse the situation. I don't know if it's still possible, but do what you can."

The Praetor hails you, looking absolutely furious. "You meddlesome Renegade. You think that you can simply dictate the policy of whomever you come across? I don't care how powerful you think you are, or who you claim to represent. The Gathering will no longer sit on the galactic sidelines and be told what to do!" The Praetor ship arms its weapons. This will likely be a difficult fight.
You stay back and marvel at the planet from afar.

event.name: ORCHID_GARDENWORLD_SURRENDER
event.text: The Orchid cruiser is on the brink of defeat. Although their resolve doesn't waver, you could try one last attempt at diplomacy.

choice.text: Try to end the fight diplomatically.

event.text: You hail them, and the ship momentarily stops fighting you. Praetor Bralmeb seems frazzled, but still angry. "What, do you want me to grovel for my life? You want me to roll over and accept your way of doing things?"

choice.text: (Ivar) Tell them who they just fired upon.

event.text:
"Hey! Roothead! You just fired upon the premier of the Vampweeds! Do you realize what that means?"
Bralmeb seems uncomfortable. "Well... I..."
"So you're lucky that the attractive powerhouses over here love making peace as much as I do! Listen, this doesn't HAVE to be an interstellar incident. Just calm down, take your lumps and listen to this lovely Caretaker without judgement, okay?"
Bralmeb is still miffed, but for the moment he seems pacified.

Ty E'Rel takes a stern posture. "You have committed an unprovoked attack on a vessel carrying the primary diplomatic envoy between the Oro'Bache and the Ctl'Yae. As stated in the Kadahellian'ek Treaty, this is a grade 1 offense and is considered treason."
Bralmeb seems uncomfortable. "Unprovoked...? You..."
"I would like to remind you how 'provocation' is defined within the Accords. Or have you not read them? They were written before you sprouted. I should know, though, I was the third person to sign."
Bralmeb stutters, and falls silent. He disengages his weapons systems.

choice.text: (Tully) Get to the root of the problem.

event.text:
"This is Admiral Tully of the Federation fleet. Stand down, I repeat, stand down."
Bralmeb responds immediately. "Tully...? Why are you involving yourself in our affairs?"
"You said that you were stepping up military production because you feel that you are not properly represented on the galactic stage. Is that true?" Bralmeb nods. Tully continues. "Your people are often hesitant to ask for planets in other systems or military aid. Why then, are you resorting to such drastic measures in your own space?"
"...it is not our way. We do not like to be seen as dependent. We want to be self sufficient and provide for others."
"The Federation is meant to be a collaborative effort. We encourage you to ask for more - after all, your people are often generous."
Bralmeb pauses, and backs down without another word.

choice.text: You attacked us before we could talk. At least let us get a word in.

event.text: "Fine, but it will not change anything. Make your case."
"Hmph! I'm no scientist. I am a soldier, and if we want to be relevant, we have to bolster our forces. You criticize me for being ignorant. In my opinion, it's you who is ignorant!"

choice.text: Ask him if he has any scientists backing up his position.

event.text: Bralmeb grumbles. "If you won't listen to my viewpoint, then this conversation is over." Bralmeb stares at you for a moment. "I've gotten word that you helped out my colleagues. For that reason, I see no need to continue this fight. But my people need this, and I will not let them down." Just like that, he cuts comms again.

choice.text: Ask him if he has any scientists backing up his position.

event.text: "I've had enough of this! You won't listen to reason!" Just like that, he cuts comms again. Looks like it's back to fighting.

choice.text: Remind him that you serve your own military.

event.text: "I suppose that you are. Tell me, why would you decline to make the Federation stronger when you're currently on the run from a fleet of Rebel ships? Where's the logic in that?"

choice.text: We're not compromising who we are by doing what we're doing.

event.text: "Hmph, I thought we were getting somewhere." Bralmeb shakes his head. "If you're going to question my integrity, then this conversation is over." Bralmeb stares at you for a moment. "I've gotten word that you helped out my colleagues. For that reason, I see no need to continue this fight. But my people need this, and I will not let them down." Just like that, he cuts comms again.

choice.text: We're not compromising who we are by doing what we're doing.

event.text: "Hmph, I thought we were getting somewhere. You're just as foolish as the rest of them." Just like that, he cuts comms again. Looks like it's back to fighting.

choice.text: If you want to be stronger for the Federation, why not ask them for new worlds to use, or other ways to help?

event.text: "Our representatives do not like to make a lot of requests. It is not our way. Yes, it would be... better if we could get more out of this alliance, but this is all we can do."

choice.text: Then isn't your quarrel with your representatives, not the Caretakers?

event.text: Bralmeb falls silent. "...Very well. Maybe I am fighting the wrong people. I will back down. But if I can make no headway with our advocates, then do not fault me for pressing for this again."

choice.text: Tell him that he is being too aggressive, and to calm down before we engage in discourse.

event.text: "Too aggressive? How dare you! I don't have to listen to this." Just like that, he cuts comms again. Looks like it's back to fighting.

event.name: ORCHID_GARDENWORLD_MAYEB_WIN
event.text: Counsellor Pael and Mayeb adjudicate for a moment. Mayeb looks pleased. Pael clears his throat and addresses you. "Very well, as we re-settle the life from the freighter we will carefully review the data from the Caretakers. Perhaps we were... overzealous in our desire to bolster our military strength. And... as for you, Captain, we would like to sincerely apologize if your ship was damaged. Please accept a reimbursement from the Gathering for your trouble."

Mayeb smiles at you. "You have done so much for the Caretakers of Rt'lak Et. We were able to grow a special Caretaker cruiser for long ranged ecological missions... maybe it will prove useful to you. And... you've gone above and beyond on my behalf so... I would like to join your crew, if you're willing. I'm the Grand Gardener, but with the situation resolved peacefully, I think my peers can handle things without me. What do you say?"

event.name: ORCHID_GARDENWORLD_UNEASY_RESOLUTION
event.text: Counsellor Pael looks uneasy. "For better or for worse, it looks like we'll have to resettle for the immediate future. We'll have to address these problems over the course of the next few weeks. Months, even. Whatever happens, I appreciate your restraint. We hope this scrap will aid you on your trek to Node 17."

Mayeb smiles. "Thank you for taking our side. These next few months are going to be busy, but you've given us more than enough of a headstart. All I have to offer right now is one of our finest weapons, freshly grown. May it serve you well."

event.name: ORCHID_GARDENWORLD_DEFEAT
event.text: You have vanquished the Orchid Cruiser. However, the other Orchid defenses in the area probably wouldn't take too kindly to you scrapping their ship. You have no choice but to leave it adrift.

Counsellor Pael sighs. "You've put us in a difficult situation here, Renegade. The freighter is not designed to be in operation for as long as it has, so we will have no choice but to reverse the decision for now. Please go, you've troubled us enough."
Mayeb nods. "It's too bad you were not able to spare them, captain. I appreciate your assistance, but the way this was resolved, I'm going to have to keep fighting for my cause. I wish I could offer more."

event.name: GATHERING_LOW_TRAFFIC
event.text: This area of the Gathering seems to normally be a low-traffic region. Despite this, an Orchid distress call is coming from this area.

event.name: DISTRESS_ORCHID_PIRATE_TRAP
event.text: The transmitter is adrift, unconnected to any ship. A pirate blocks your path. "You're not one of these leafy weenies, but you'll do!" Looks like this was a trap!

event.name: DISTRESS_ORCHID_AMBASSADOR
event.text: A badly damaged cruiser of Orchid design is sending out a distress call. A Coalition Predator follows close behind, firing upon it.

You're greeted by a visibly withered Orchid. Both of his heritages are identifiable, having notable traits from both the Florals and the Vampweeds. Despite the state of his ship, he hasn't lost his veneer of professionalism. "Salutations. My name is Ty E'Rel." He gestures to the attacking ship. "Any assistance you could offer would be greatly appreciated." However, the moment you contact the Orchids, you attract the attention of the Coalition Predator.

choice.text: Demand that the Coalition ship stop firing.

event.text: You decide not to get involved - the Coalition ship remains focused on the unusual Orchid cruiser.

event.name: TY_EREL_RESCUE_GATHERING
event.text: The Coalition Predator is vanquished. The Ambassadorial Cruiser approaches yours as you scrap the Predator's remains.

The elderly plant appears on your viewscreen. He looks completely unruffled despite the recent attempt on his life. "Your arrival is timely. My compliments to your punctuality. My ship isn't in the best condition, but I would be more than happy to let you take it back to the Federation."
